DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Peripheral Sensory Neuropathy Classification Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a position on a scale from a method of generalization the functional disturbance or pathological change in the peripheral nervous system; sometimes limited to non inflammatory lesions as opposed to those of neuritis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Peripheral Sensory Neuropathy Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a method of generalization about the functional disturbance or pathological change in the peripheral nervous system; sometimes limited to non inflammatory lesions as opposed to those of neuritis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: functional disturbance or pathological change in the peripheral nervous system; sometimes limited to noninflammatory lesions as opposed to those of neuritis; etiology may be known or unknown.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation or degeneration of the sensory nerves.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of the functional disturbance or pathological change in the peripheral nervous system; sometimes limited to non inflammatory lesions as opposed to those of neuritis.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 2: Paresthesia,pain,or numbness that is controlled by non-narcotic meds(w/o causing loss of function),or alteration of fine motor skills(buttoning shirt,writing or drawing,using eating utensils)or gait,w/o abrogating ability to perform these tasks.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 2: Paresthesia,pain,or numbness that is controlled by non-narcotic meds(w/o causing loss of function),or alteration of fine motor skills(buttoning shirt,writing or drawing,using eating utensils)or gait,w/o abrogating ability to perform these tasks.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 2: Paresthesia, pain, or numbness that is controlled by non-narcotic medications (without causing loss of function), or alteration of fine motor skills (buttoning shirt, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or gait, without abrogating ability to perform these tasks.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 3: Paresthesia or pain that is controlled by narcotics,or interfere w/extremity function(gait,fine motor skills i.e.buttoning shirt,writing/drawing,using eating utensils),or QOL (loss of sleep,ability to perform normal activities severely impaired).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 3: Paresthesia or pain that is controlled by narcotics,or interfere w/extremity function(gait,fine motor skills i.e.buttoning shirt,writing/drawing,using eating utensils),or QOL (loss of sleep,ability to perform normal activities severely impaired).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 3: Paresthesia or pain that is controlled by narcotics, or interfere with extremity function (gait, fine motor skills i.e. buttoning shirt, writing or drawing, using eating utensils), or quality of life (loss of sleep, ability to perform normal activities severely impaired).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 4: Complete loss of sensation or pain that is not controlled by narcotics.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 4: Complete loss of sensation or pain that is not controlled by narcotics.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 4: Complete loss of sensation or pain that is not controlled by narcotics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 1: Paresthesia, pain, or numbness that do not require treatment or interfere with extremity function.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 1: Paresthesia, pain, or numbness that do not require treatment or interfere with extremity function.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 1: Paresthesia, pain, or numbness that do not require treatment or interfere with extremity function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
